verses.verse: (Praise and Prayer for Victory) A Song. A Psalm of David. (Ps 57.7) My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; (Heb mss Gk Syr: MT lacks my heart is steadfast) I will sing and make melody. Awake, my soul! (Cn Compare 57.8: Heb also my soul)
(Ps 57.8-11) Awake, O harp and lyre! I will awake the dawn.
I will give thanks to you, O LORD, among the peoples, and I will sing praises to you among the nations.
(Ps 113.4) For your steadfast love is higher than the heavens, and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, and let your glory be over all the earth.
(Ps 60.5-12) Give victory with your right hand, and answer me, so that those whom you love may be rescued.
God has promised in his sanctuary: (Or by his holiness) “With exultation I will divide up Shechem and portion out the Vale of Succoth.
(Ps 60.7) Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.
Moab is my washbasin; on Edom I hurl my shoe; over Philistia I shout in triumph.”
Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
(Ps 44.9) Have you not rejected us, O God? You do not go out, O God, with our armies.
O grant us help against the foe, for human help is worthless.
With God we shall do valiantly; it is he who will tread down our foes.
